Class MessageHeader

java.lang.Object
express.mvp.myra.codec.runtime.struct.MessageHeader
All Implemented Interfaces:
express.mvp.roray.ffm.utils.memory.FlyweightAccessor
public final class MessageHeader extends Object implements express.mvp.roray.ffm.utils.memory.FlyweightAccessor
A flyweight for the standard 16-byte MyraCodec message header. This is a foundational, fixed-structure component of the MyraCodec runtime.

Wire Format

+-------------+-------------+----------------+-------+----------+----------+
| Frame Length| Template ID | Schema Version | Flags | Reserved | Checksum |
|  (4 bytes)  |  (2 bytes)  |    (2 bytes)   |(1 byte)|(3 bytes)| (4 bytes)|
+-------------+-------------+----------------+-------+----------+----------+

Thread Safety

This class is NOT thread-safe. Each thread should use its own MessageHeader instance. The flyweight pattern is designed for single-threaded access with instance reuse via wrap(MemorySegment, long).

The underlying MemorySegment may be shared, but concurrent access to the same memory region requires external synchronization.

Typical usage pattern: 

// Reusable flyweight (per-thread)
MessageHeader header = new MessageHeader();

// Wrap around received data
header.wrap(receivedSegment, 0);
int templateId = header.getTemplateId();
int frameLen = header.getFrameLength();
